page.title: 14RUISLIP/EASTCOTE ENVIRONMENT
page.content: The majority of people we interviewed had lived in the area for more than 10 years indicating that they are content and when asked most people thought the area to be a pleasant environment and would not wish to move away. To measure the quality of the environment an appraisal method was used assessing features such as graffitti, vandalism and litter on a scale of 1 (poor) to 10 (good). The areas scored highly with an average of 8, with many people liking features such as the duck pond, Old Ruislip and Saint Martin's Church. There appears to be some concern from local residents over the lack of sports facilities. At present there is a squash club but this is due for closure shortly. Local societies include a Bridge club and a British Legion branch.
